Package xyz.rk0cc.willpub.pubspec.data

Class PubspecSnapshot

java.lang.Object
xyz.rk0cc.willpub.pubspec.data.PubspecSnapshot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class PubspecSnapshot extends Object implements Serializable
A memento-liked object which archive current Pubspec state data to immutable snapshot.
Unlike Pubspec, it can not be serialized by ObjectMapper.writeValue(File, Object) since it aims to archive state of data, not a final result which write to pubspec.yaml.
To get a snapshot, the one and only way is invoking getSnapshotOfCurrentPubspec(Pubspec). To restore data, it provides either recoverPubspec(Pubspec) or getMutableFromSnapshot(PubspecSnapshot) depending on different scenario.
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:

    • getSnapshotOfCurrentPubspec

      @Nonnull public static PubspecSnapshot getSnapshotOfCurrentPubspec(@Nonnull Pubspec pubspec)
      Take a snapshot of given Pubspec, then generated PubspecSnapshot which contains Pubspec data in current state. And no changes if Pubspec applied new state.
      Parameters:
      pubspec - A Pubspec that want to get a snapshot.
      Returns:
      A snapshot which referencing the state of Pubspec when it invoked.

    • getMutableFromSnapshot

      @Nonnull public static Pubspec getMutableFromSnapshot(@Nonnull PubspecSnapshot snapshot)
      Generate new mutable Pubspec from this snapshot.
      Unlike recoverPubspec(Pubspec), it creates a completely new Pubspec object which does not affect existed one.
      Parameters:
      snapshot - A snapshot which will be uses to create new mutable Pubspec.
      Returns:
      A new Pubspec which using snapshot data.
      See Also:
      • recoverPubspec(Pubspec)
